Subject: Re: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4

Hi,

Here is my feedback... not an expert one, but a junior one...
maybe it=
 helps to have one of those too :-D

I like the general idea, but it make m=
e think a few things...

what if the parameters are not that easy to constr=
uct...?
they are not plain type, but more complex classes...
i could mock t=
hem or just populate them in some way.
For example, one parameter could be =
a collection of things...
so i would need to create and populate the collec=
tion
(i don't think it's really a good example, you could always use Arrays=
.asList(),
but i hope it helps to understand my point )

In those cases, i =
couldn't just put them in the @Parameters array that easy.
Maybe i could us=
e an initialize block, and have a static helper
method, to populate
the arr=
ay.

Another thing i see, is that... 
in one way, i like being able to see =
the test data with the test.
but, i may have the necessity to have it outsi=
de (i.e. if i have many
sets of test)
so, i would be nice to have an altern=
ative way to set the parameters.

One last though. Having all the parameter=
s in an array could make me
in some cases to forgot what that parameter is.=
...they are not named after all..
I don't know this is a real problem, it's=
 simpler the way it is...
but maybe if you have 5 o 6 parameters per testca=
se,
then you could easily forgot which is which... (is this expression
alri=
ght!??? :S)
But, i repeat, this may not be a problem of the parameter test.=
..
maybe is the test that shouldn't need so many arguments...

Well, that's=
 all...
hope it helps...

Regards,
Mariano Cortesi
